Core Content from Research: Partial architecture review = focused exam of specific IT components (e.g., API gateways) in grey box testing (limited knowledge like diagrams/credentials). Differs from full review (entire system). Integrates PTES (Intelligence Gathering, Vulnerability Analysis), ethical hacking simulations. Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE]. Scaffolding Layers: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE]. Active Learning: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - reference in explanations. Generate 25-30 flashcards per EXACT schema: Output as JSON array of objects, e.g., [{'type': 'Multiple Choice', 'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'bloom_level': 'Analyze', 'layer': 2, 'tags': ['PTES', 'grey-box']}, ...]. Balance: 20% Remember/Understand, 30% Apply/Analyze, 30% Evaluate/Create, 20% integration. Use schema structure/distractors/explanations precisely. Ensure accuracy, no criminal advice. Cover examples/non-examples, concept map nodes, MCQ misconceptions.
